metadata.title: CVE-2021-30888 on Ubuntu 21.10 (impish) - medium.
metadata.description:
An information leakage issue was addressed. This issue is fixed in iOS 15.1 and iPadOS 15.1, macOS Monterey 12.0.1, iOS 14.8.1 and iPadOS 14.8.1, tvOS 15.1, watchOS 8.1. A malicious website using Content Security Policy reports may be able to leak information via redirect behavior .

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo ua fix CVE-2021-30888` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

gir1.2-javascriptcoregtk-4.0 - 2.34.0-1ubuntu1
gir1.2-webkit2-4.0 - 2.34.0-1ubuntu1
libjavascriptcoregtk-4.0-18 - 2.34.0-1ubuntu1
libjavascriptcoregtk-4.0-bin - 2.34.0-1ubuntu1
libwebkit2gtk-4.0-37 - 2.34.0-1ubuntu1
webkit2gtk-driver - 2.34.0-1ubuntu1
No subscription required

notes.note: jdstrand> webkit receives limited support. For details, see https://wiki.ubuntu.com/SecurityTeam/FAQ#webkit webkit in Ubuntu uses the JavaScriptCore (JSC) engine, not V8

criterions.comment: qtwebkit-opensource-src package in impish is affected and may need fixing.
webkit2gtk package in impish was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2.34.0-1ubuntu1').
wpewebkit package in impish is affected and may need fixing.
